instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.S4_PWR_EN: What is S4_PWR_EN? S4_PWR_EN turns on the S4 power rails. Signals ending in _EN enable whatever came before _EN in the signal name when the voltage of the signal is high. .
definitions.P5VS4RS3_EN: What is P5VS4RS3_EN? PP5VS4RS3_EN is a signal that enables the PP5V_S4RS3 power rail. When you see _EN in front of a signal name, it means that it is enabling whatever comes before the _EN when the signal is high..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liqued damage pp3v3 lines drop
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> 0.000volt replaced <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> then 3.4v




<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> 0.000v
<SIGNAL>P5VS4RS3_EN</SIGNAL> 0.000v
<SIGNAL>S4_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> 0.000v
pm _slp_s4_l missing

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> also missing

after replacing
<CAPACITOR>C5120</CAPACITOR> and <RESISTOR>R5127</RESISTOR> because they look back
i get <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> for a short moment and also fan spin.
after few second the <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> drops back to 0.513volt

all pp3v3 rails drop after few second.....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liqued damage pp3v3 lines drop
threads.message: PPBUS? Checked all rails for shorts?
